posts.author: danielprichardson
posts.post_text: March 1, 2016 at 9:31 PM#2Can it be a separate fader that controls the gobo spin speed? Or do you need to use a Speed Master?If it can be a separate fader that only controls the speed for gobo spin, then it is quite simple.--Solution 1:Set your fixture profile's default value for gobo spin at a real world value of "stop" (the stop that is in between the two spins).Get the fixture doing the fastest rotate speed you would want and store it to an empty fader.Assign the fader as a Temp Fader.--Solution 2:Save a cue with the fixtures at a gobo rotate value of "stop". Make sure this cue is always on.Get the fixture doing the fastest rotate speed you would want and store it to an empty fader.Assign the fader as a Temp Fader.--Solution 3:Store a gobo preset with the fixtures at a gobo rotate value of "stop".Assign preset "stop" please, and select "Default".Double tap the preset once to enact the default then clear all.Get the fixture doing the fastest rotate speed you would want and store it to an empty fader.Assign the fader as a Temp Fader.--This fader will now control the speed of your gobo rotate from "stop" to the value you set. I don't think you could do it from one of the speed masters.The only difference between the solutions is in (1) you set the default value for the gobo rotate, (2) you save the stop state as cue and (3) you assign a preset default.
